properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 12 at 3:27PM CST until February 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Kansas City/Pleasant HIll MO
properties.description:
...Wintry Mess into Tonight...

.Expect moderate to light snowfall to persist into the evening
hours when a strong arctic cold front will blast into the region,
putting a stop to the snow, but also bringing dangerously cold
wind chills to the region Thursday morning.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow
accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory,
very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 below
zero.

* WHERE...Randolph County.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST
tonight. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to
noon CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The
cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions
are not taken.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1 in Kansas or visiting
traveler.modot.org in Missouri.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST THURSDAY
